p: Of all the individual small mammals captured and tested in this study, none were PCR- and IgG-positive at the same time. Because arenavirus infection was most extensive in Mastomys natalensis populations, we attempted to examine variation in prevalence according to locality, season, and age in this species. However, our analyses did not show prevalence for any of these variables to be statistically significant (Table 2). Although not statistically significant, PCR and IgG distribution for key Mastomys populations are depicted by season (Fig. 2), sex and age (Fig. 3).
